title: Clinical Molecular Genetics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: The course covers [1] understanding of DNA structure, human genome and application of various molecular techniques in current clinical molecular laboratory including PCR technique, Southern analysis, targeted mutation analysis, gene scanning, gene sequencing, SNP array analysis , next generation sequencing, identity testing; [2] developing preanalytic and postanalytic skills including interpretation of test results, report writing and communication of result to clinicians.
outcome: The students are expected to learn the basic principle and advanced knowledge on clinical and molecular genetics
syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
required_readings: The required readings will be proivded in the first lesson.
recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be proivded in the first lesson.

title: Clinical Biochemical Genetics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: Understanding [1]genetic basis of inborn errors of metabolism[2] the acute presentation of inborn errors of metabolism such as hypoglycaemia, metabolic acidosis, hyperammonemia and other metabolic crisis[3] the interpretation of abnormal screening test results [4] how to apply the principles of effective communication in taking care of patients with or at-risk of specific genetic conditions.
outcome: Students are expected to acquire general assessment skills and investigation methods for inborn errors of metabolism.
syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

title: Clinical Genetics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics and MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
description: Clinical genetics deals with direct clinical care of patients with genetic disease, including diagnosis, management and counselling as well as development of a genomic approach to human diseases in clinical setting which requires the application of all of the basic principles of medical genetics taught in this course.
outcome: Students are expected to acquire the diagnosis, management and counselling skills.
syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

title: Clinical Cytogenetics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics and MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
description: The course covers the understanding of DNA and its architecture, cell division and the use of various techniques to examine these structures, including chromosome banding, FISH and array CGH. It also covers the application of these techniques for the detection of chromosomal abnormalities, developing preanalytic and postanalytic skills in test results interpretation, report writing and communication of result to clinicians.
outcome: Students are expected to understand and be able to conduct karyotyping analysis on prenatal and postnatal samples including result interpretation and write up report.
syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

title: Population Genetics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: The course covers [1] risk assessment of a given genetic condition [2] implications of population screening for carriers of disease causing genes [3] gene mapping and identification of genes responsible for the predisposition to disease like cancers and autism [4] interpretation of DNA matching for paternity testing or forensic purposes [5] study of world-wide genetic variation among human populations.
outcome: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on population genetics.
syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

title: Genome informatics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: The course introduces the basic concepts, methods and tools used in bioinformatics including bioinformatics databases, sequence alignment and phylogeny, protein structure prediction, protein-protein interaction, molecular dynamics and other essential data mining algorithms with the aim of helping students to use bioinformatics tools and data to answer biological questions and to solve clinical problems.
outcome: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on genome informatics, including access to public database and conduct data analysis.
syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

title: Genetic Counselling
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics and MSc Obstetric Care and MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology and MSc Obstetric and Midwifery Care
description: Genetic counselling is a communication process which involves [1] conveying medical facts including diagnosis, course of the disorder and available treatment[2] understanding the pattern of inheritance and the risk of carrying the gene in specific relatives [3] understanding the alternatives for dealing with the risk [4] choosing an appropriate course of action by taking into account their risk, family goals, ethical and religious standard, and in accordance with their decision[5] making the best possible adjustment to the disorder of the affected family member and/or the risk of recurrence of the disorder.
outcome: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge and skill on genetic counselling, especially common cancer including hematological cancers.
syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

title: Cancer Genetics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: This course focuses primarily on hematological malignancies including leukemia, lymphoma and myeloma, and will cover their pathogenesis and use of molecular and cytogenetic techniques for diagnosis, prognostication and treatment.

title: Scientific Skills, Laboratory Safety and Management
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics and MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
description: [1] Presentation and communication skills: This module will cover generation, transmission and reception of messages; conflict resolution and negotiation; defining objectives; modes of presentation and communication including prompts, ideas, memos, letters, resumes, proposals, tenders, posters, theses, research papers and grant applications; critical analysis, argument and opinion; plagiarism and citation; presentation skills including poster and oral presentations, public speaking, interview and phone interview; use of audio-visual aids.[2] Laboratory safety: It covers biosafety levels; laboratory containment, design and facilities; laboratory equipment; fire and electrical safety; guidelines and code of practice; safety organization and surveillance; safety checklist, trainingprogramme and rules for supportive staff; disinfection, decontamination and disposal of bio-hazardous, chemical and radioactive waste.[3] Laboratory management: It deals with the organization of core laboratory and reference laboratory, laboratory practice regulations, implementation and monitoring of laboratory safety, equipment evaluation, financial budgeting and controlling, tendering, stock taking, auditing, decision making, formulation of laboratory policies and standard operating procedure, laboratory accreditation, personnel management, handling conflicts in work environment.

title: Prenatal and Paediatric Genetics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: The course deals with prenatal dysmorphology and genetic syndromes. It will also cover the principles of prenatal screening and diagnosis with emphasis on screening for Down syndrome and other fetal aneuploidies.

title: Adult and Cancer Genetics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: The course covers the diagnosis, counseling and management of late onset genetic diseases, common hereditary cancers and cancer predisposition syndromes. It also includes the quantitative methods in cancer risk assessment, laboratory methods of cancer genetic testing, genetic testing in the management of patients with cancer, reproductive counseling for cancer patients and families.

title: Advanced Clinical Genetics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: The course teaches recognizable patterns of human malformation using a combined approach encompassing dysmorphology, formulation of diagnosis, advanced laboratory testing, management and therapy.

title: Frontiers in Genomic Medicine and Laboratory Technologies
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: The course introduces the latest concepts, methods and tools used in genomic medicine with the aim to provide an in-depth knowledge on how to answer biological questions. Special emphasis will be put on the application and interpretation of microarray and next-generation sequencing data.

title: Ethics and Law
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: The course deals with psychological, ethical and legal issues in prenatal genetic testing, cancer genetic testing and reproductive genetic testing, and problem of confidentiality.

title: Research Project
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: Research topics related to genomic and clinical genetics will be provided by the principal investigators from the Chinese University of Hong Kong, Baylor College of Medicine, Harvard Medical School and Peking Union Medical College. The research project will either be a laboratory-based or clinical data-based investigation. Students are required to write up the result in a dissertation.
outcome: Students are expected to demonstrate competency in the application of research methodologies. In adedition, they are able to synthesise and critically evaluate published information and present it in written format.
syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

title: Prenatal and Adult Genetics
requirements: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
description: Part 1 - Prenatal GeneticsThe course deals with prenatal dysmorphology and genetic syndromes. It will also cover the principles of prenatal screening and diagnosis with emphasis on screening for Down syndrome and other fetal aneuploidies.Part 2 - Adult GeneticsThe course covers the diagnosis, counseling and management of late onset genetic diseases. It includes BRCA1/2, hereditary colon cancer, cancer genetic syndromes I (Haemat), cancer genetic syndromes, DNA breakage disorders, Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, Marfan syndrome & related disorders, hereditary cardiomyopathy and cardiac conductions defects, neurodegeneration (Parkinson, Alzheimer, & related disorders), hereditary sensory motor neuropathies, genes and hearing, hereditary sensory motor neuropathies, head and neck region with some peripheral neuropathies, triplet repeat disorders in adults and mitochondrial disorders.
